data.title: Polish Film Institute at EFM 2024
data.meta_description: Strona internetowa PISF - Polskiego Instytutu Sztuki Filmowej
data.text:
The General Director of Polish Film Institute, Radosław Śmigulski, alongside representatives from PFI will attend the European Film Market 2024 during this year’s Berlinale Film Festival. The industry event will take place from 15th until 21st of February.

The General Director of Polish Film Institute, Radosław Śmigulski, alongside representatives from PFI, as always, will attend the European Film Market. The Polish Cinema Stand – number 184 – situated in the Martin-Gropius Bau building at Stresemannstr. 110, will be the Polish hub for meetings with industry representatives, interested in obtaining the most important information regarding collaboration with the Polish Film Institute. At the Polish Cinema Stand market attending industry can find information about the different film financing programes offered by PFI, examples of great Polish filming locations, current Polish film productions as well as its a great place for meeting with Polish creatives and Polish producers.

EFM 2024 – bilateral and co-production meetings

In order to promote Polish culture and support the operations of Polish producers, looking for international business partners, during EFM, the Polish Film Institute will hold two sessions of co-production and bilateral meetings.

On the 17th of February at Crowne Plaza there will be a bilateral meeting with industry representatives from Brazil, Colombia, Mexico and Chile. (Participant submissions to this 1:1 event has already been finalized.)

On the 19th of February at stand 184 at Martin-Gropius Bau PFI will hold an industry meeting with representatives from Taiwan and Japan.( Sign-ups for this event has also been finalized.)

Representatives from Polish Film Institute will also attend the events of the Berlin Co-Production Market. The biggest one is the Country Session held on 18th of February at Casino Hall at Berlin House of Representatives. During an hour meeting that starts at 15.30, the representatives of cultural organizations from eight different countries (Netherlands, Canada, Germany, China, Ireland, Spain and Bosnia and Hercegovina, alongside Poland) will present their country’s financial system and co-production capabilities.

On the 18th PFI will participate in two other important events. At 13.15 at Casino there will be a Co-Production Market Lunch, co – hosted by Polish Film Institute. Later in the day at 18.00 there will be a Happy Hour at the Polish Cinema stand nr.184 at Martin-Gropius Bau building – this will be an occasion to talk and mingle in a more casual manner with Polish talent, creatives and producers.

The next day – on the 19th of February, the coordinator of the 30% Cash Rebate Programme will meet up with the participants of EFM during the Fund Meeting. Between 14.00 and 18.00 particpipants of the market will be able to obtain information about the programme.

EFM – market screening of a new Polish production and a co-production presentation

During the European Film Market „Nothing about you scares me” by Justyna Nowak, will be screened during the Short Film Showcase at CinemaxX Studio at 11.45 on 21st of February.

The first Polish post-hipster melodrama, in which Matylda, Helena and Juri need to take responsibility for the roles they play in their social microcosm. During the production of the play based on Aristophanes’ „Birds” the three artist friends face the painful truth about themselves.

During the „The presentation of the upcoming Belarusians film projects”, which will take place on the 16th at 18.00 at the Conference Lounge at Gropius Park building, there will be a pitching session for “Under the grey sky” by Mara Tamkovich, which is co-financed by Polish Film Institute. It’s a Polish-Bulgarian co-production, concerned with the Belarussian protests agains the government in 2020 and the imprisonment of one of the journalists. The event is part of the Belarusian Independend Film Academy showreel, which is aimed at obtaining partners, sales agents and distribiutors.

European Shooting Stars 2024

Representatives of Polish Film Institute will also take part of the European Shooting Stars programme, during the 16th and 19th of February. One of the participating talent this year is Polish actress, Kamila Urzędowska, who stole the hearts of cinema viewers as Jagna in “The Peasants” by DK and Hugh Welchman.

Curious to know who will attend EFM? Check out the Poles in Berlin catalogue!

The list of representatives from Polish Film Institute as well as participating producers and creatives from Poland can be found in our Poles in Berlin catalogue. There is also a special “New Polish Fillms” and “New Polish Shorts” catalogues with current information on the newest Polish film productions, premieres and film releases for 2024.

Two shorts shown in the Forum section

Two short films have been selected for the Forum Expanded section of Berlinale.

„Grandmamauntsistercat” by Zuza Banasińska is a visual essay, created from archival materials of the Educational Film Studio in Łódź, about a matriarchal family through the eyes of a child grappling with the reproduction of ideological and representational systems. Originally created as didactic and propagandistic tools in communist Poland, the footage is repurposed as a site of auto-fictional memory.

The short will be screened on the 16th of February at 16.00 in the Arsenal 1 screening room; on the 17th of February at 20.00 in Cinema Betonhalle@Silent Green at 19.30 and on February 22nd at in Arsenal 2 screening room.

“Room 404” by Elysa Wendi, Wai Shing Lee, the studenst of Lodz Film School is another visual essay and a reimagination of a previous project by the duo. The official synopsis states: “A never-ending typhoon outside of room 525 in Hong Kong has transposed the artist duo into an unsettling situation of digital error of 404 in the present time. Originally taking their inspiration from the concept of Room 666 by Wim Wenders, Elysa Wendi and Wai Shing Lee invited various artists to the hotel room 525 during an art residency in 2019”.

The film will be screened on Monday 19th, 19.00 at Arsenal screening room, on 20th of February at 12.00 in Cinema Betonhalle@Silent Green and on 24th of February at 19.30 in Arsenal 2 screening room.

We wish all attending industry creatives a prosporous time at the market, fueled by visonary and productive meetings for this years EFM & Berlinale!

We welcome and look forward to seeing you all at the Polish Cinema Stand nr 184!
